title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, pancetta, and black pepper.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Cook spaghetti in salted water until al dente.
Fry pancetta with garlic until crisp.
Whisk eggs and Parmesan together.
Drain pasta, add to pancetta, and remove from heat.
Quickly mix in egg mixture to create a creamy sauce.
Season with salt and pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken cooked in a smooth buttery and creamy tomato-based gravy.
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices for at least 30 minutes.
Grill or pan-fry the chicken until golden.
Cook onions, garlic, and ginger in a pan.
Add tomatoes and simmer until thickened.
Stir in cream and cooked chicken.
Simmer 10 minutes and serve.

title: Beef Bourguignon
summary: French beef stew braised in red wine with mushrooms, onions, and bacon.
instructions: Brown bacon and beef in a heavy pot.
Add carrots, onion, and garlic; cook until softened.
Sprinkle flour and stir well.
Pour in wine and stock; add herbs.
Simmer covered for 2 hours.
Add mushrooms and cook until tender.

title: Margherita Pizza
summary: Thin-crust pizza topped with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, basil, and olive oil.
instructions: Preheat oven to 220°C.
Roll out pizza dough on a tray.
Top with tomato slices, mozzarella, and basil.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt.
Bake for 10–12 minutes until crust is crisp.

title: Pad Thai
summary: Stir-fried rice noodles with shrimp, tofu, peanuts, egg, and tamarind sauce.
instructions: Soak rice noodles until soft.
Stir-fry tofu and shrimp in oil.
Push aside and scramble eggs.
Add noodles, tamarind, fish sauce, and sugar.
Toss with bean sprouts and peanuts before serving.

title: Sushi Platter
summary: An assortment of onigiri and maki rolls with fresh fish and seasoned rice.
instructions: Cook rice, then season with vinegar mixture.
Slice fish into thin strips.
Place rice on nori, add fish, and roll tightly.
Slice rolls and arrange with nigiri.
Serve with soy, wasabi, and ginger.

title: Ratatouille
summary: A Provençal vegetable casserole of eggplant, zucchini, peppers, and tomatoes.
instructions: Slice all vegetables evenly.
Sauté garlic in olive oil, then layer vegetables in a dish.
Season with herbs, salt, and pepper.
Bake at 190°C for 40 minutes until tender.

title: Shakshuka
summary: Poached eggs in a spicy tomato and pepper sauce; great for breakfast or brunch.
instructions: Cook onion, pepper, and garlic in a skillet.
Add tomatoes and spices, simmer 10 minutes.
Make wells and crack eggs into them.
Cover and cook until eggs are set.

title: Fish and Chips
summary: Crispy beer-battered fish served with thick-cut fries and tartar sauce.
instructions: Cut potatoes into thick fries and soak in water.
Mix flour, baking powder, and beer into a batter.
Coat fish fillets and deep fry until golden.
Fry potatoes until crisp.
Serve with tartar sauce.

title: Bibimbap
summary: Korean mixed rice bowl with vegetables, gochujang, and a fried egg.
instructions: Stir-fry vegetables separately and season lightly.
Cook beef slices with soy sauce and sesame oil.
Arrange rice in bowls and top with vegetables and beef.
Fry eggs and place on top.
Serve with gochujang.

title: Beef Tacos
summary: Soft tortillas filled with seasoned beef, salsa, cheese, and fresh cilantro.
instructions: Cook beef with onion, garlic, and spices.
Warm tortillas.
Fill tortillas with beef, cheese, salsa, and cilantro.
Serve immediately.

title: Greek Salad
summary: Crisp salad with tomatoes, cucumber, olives, red onion, feta, and olive oil.
instructions: Combine tomatoes, cucumber, onion, olives, and feta in a bowl.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle oregano.
Toss gently and serve.
